moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. e3 Bb4: This is generally considered inaccurate and should be met with 5. Qa4+ Nc6 which blocks off black's c pawn but I did not take advantage
moves.5. a3: A mistake on my part but certainly not game ending
moves.5... Be7 6. Nf3: I think 6. Bd3 is better here because it doesn't allow the game continuation
moves.6... Ne4 7. Nxe4 dxe4: Giving white a strong center but also forcing away the Knight, generally cramping the position, and restricting the light squared Bishop making a castle difficult
moves.8. Nd2 f5: A very strong pawn chain that will be difficult to dislodge
moves.9. Nb3: Yet another knight move. I think 9. g3 setting up the fianchetto and the castle is much better
moves.9... b6 10. g3 a5: Threatening a4 pushing my knight back to d2
moves.11. a4 Bb4+ 12. Bd2 Bxd2+ 13. Qxd2 O-O 1: Black wants that Knight in the b4 slot where it will be all but impossible to dislodge and there is little White can do about it
moves.15... Qd5 16. Qc3: Still not castling for reasons I cannot explain
moves.16... Ba6: Now I'll never castle kingside and when the Knight comes to b4 it is very powerful which basically prevents a queenside castle
moves.17. Bf1: My light squared Bishop is trapped in any case so I thought trading it off was ok but it leaves my Rook trapped
moves.17... Bxf1 18. Rxf1 g5 19. Rc1 Nb4: This is such a great spot for the Knight and White is helpless to prevent it
moves.20. Qc4: Hoping for a Queen trade giving me time to free my Rooks with Kd2 eventually
moves.20... Nd3+: I overlooked this nice little fork and the game quickly degenerates after this
moves.21. Kd2 Nxc1 22. Rxc1: My rook is free at least
moves.22... Rfb8 23. Qc2: I'm reluctant to trade Queens when down an exchange but I think 23. Qxd5 exd5 is better although it leaves Black lots of room to operate and eventually the Rook pair should prove the difference
moves.23... bxc5 24. Nxc5 Qa2: Huge pressure now on the b pawn and white can never bring enough pieces to relieve it
moves.25. Rb1 Rb4 26. Kc1: This move loses the game immediately. Better is 26. b3 Qxc2 27. Kxc2
moves.26... Rc4 27. Nb3: Thinking perhaps I could trap the Queen although this is hopeless
moves.27... Qxb3: I resigned at this point. Best perhaps is 28. Qxc4 Qxc4+ 29. Kd1 Rb1 and I will have to trade off my last piece soon enough. This game is an excellent lesson in not delaying a castle for too long. If I had taken advantage of several opportunities to get my King to safety this would have been a much better game for me.
